intro: Passerina empetrifolia, commonly known as the rock rose or rock spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its woody, sprawling stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Passerina empetrifolia is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small wildlife.
